You begin as Chell, the mute female test subject from the first game once again trying to escape the confines of Aperture Science with the help of a charming A.I. named Wheatley. Things only go downhill from there as you dig deeper into the ruins of the old facility; learning of its hidden past while forming an unlikely ally...

Experience this amazing game for yourself. The excellent; witty humor, the challenging puzzles, the well-crafted story, the intricate level design, the lovable characters, the tremendous voice acting and the unbelievable creativity shine through in all aspects. The story will last you for several hours, but once you finish it to the end there is so much more to do.  A multitude of community workshop maps to get your hands on as well as the amazing co-op mode featuring the test subjects ATLAS and P-Body make this game a must have. 

Portal 2 is one of the greatest games of this generation and stands as Valve's remarkable achievement. It improves upon the first game in every way, while standing brilliantly on it's own. Every steam user should have this game in their library. It recieves my highest recommendation.

My own Review
DISCLAIMER: this only targets the SINGLE PLAYER campaign, as I dont have anybody to play with online nor anybody in  my house for the co-op mode.

Portal 2 is a great improvement to the already really good Portal, it has a more interesting story (although cliché at this point) than the first and also evolves in a very good way

It adds new gameplay aspects overtime, meanig that throughout the campaign the game will give you new gameplay elements to use as you complete the various levels.

Also one big change to the overall game is the Lenght of the campaign. I completed the first portal in 2 HOURS, thats really short for that game, but maybe I can excuse that because it was an attempt at something new, but Portal 2 takes it out of the park with a whoping 11 HOURS for me to complete, a really good improvement.

Although one gripe i had with the game was the too many "chambers" (the sme thing as levels) there were too many for me in my opinion, because at one time it became quite stale with one gameplay aspect that was repetitive.

The graphics are great and look clean and sharp and runs at a smooth 60 fps

Overall I give this game a well deserved 10/10, the graphics are great, new gameplay elements, and better story, I could´ve given it a 9/10 for the staleness that I felt, but I dont know maybe it was me. I got it on sale but if you want to buy it right now do it, its worth every penny that youll give.
Portal 2 is by far one of my fav games, In the top 3. It can be difficult, but it has a huge story. it has alot of humor. Its  really fun to play.

Веселе продовження першого Порталу але зовсім інша історія і інші завдання) Більш відкритіший світ.

Nachdem der 1. Teil so unglaublich eingeschlagen hat und in Punkto Story und innovativem Gameplay herausragend war, war es schwer dieses Hohe Messlatte in einem Sequel erneut zu erreichen. Dennoch hat Valve hier wirklich bewiesen, dass sie es drauf haben.
Das Gameplay unterscheidet sich nicht nennenswert zum ersten Teil. Es gibt ein paar neue Elemente, die in Zusammenhang mit neuen Rätseln eingebunden wurden, wie bspw. verschiedene Schleimarten.

Die Story ist mal wieder klasse und erreicht eindeutig das Niveau, welches der 1. Teil vorgegeben hat.

Die wohl grundlegendste Neuerung ist der Coop-Modus und hierzu muss ich sagen, es ist wohl eins der besten Coop-Spiele, wenn nicht sogar das beste! Zwar ist die Spiellänge mit insgesamt etwa 15-20h - Einzel- & Multiplayer - nicht herausragend, aber dennoch gegenüber dem 1. Teil eine deutliche Aufwertung.

Soweit ich es beurteilen kann, gibt es an dem Spiel schlichtweg keine Kritikpunkte... Der einzige Grund es nicht zu kaufen/spielen wäre, wenn jemand absolut keine Rätselmensch ist. Für alle anderen sollte Portal 2 quasi ein Pflichtkauf sein, besonders wenn sie einen Kumpel zum zusammen spielen haben.


Preisempfehlung: bis 10€

The Pros:
-Nice graphics
-Funny for sure
-Can be cute
The Con (this is what made me give a thumbs down)
-I cannot solve any of the puzzles without help. There are no hints or suggestions. Additionally, timing has to be perfect one second off and you have to redo the puzzle
This is MY opinion.
Edit: I thought it would be easier hence why I played it. Had I know it would be very hard, I would have skipped it

Karakterler falan güzel de, bir yerden sonra web tabanlı beceri oyunlarına bağlıyor. Portal aç zıpla jel dök koş asansöre bin diğerine geç düğmeye bas kutu gelsin koy kutuyu asansör gelsin bin yukarı çık tareti devir bölümü geç bilmem ne çok sıkıldım. Hemen hemen hep aynı şeyler. Hani böyle 5-6 kişilik toplanması uzun süren bir arkadaş grubunuz varsa mesela, içlerinden biriyle diğerleri gelene kadar 20-30 dakika bölüm geçmeye çalışıp geçemeyip kafayı bozana kadar oynayabilirsiniz. Klasik valve oyunu işte. Çok kaliteli ve çok sıkıcı. Oynamak zorunda hissediyosun ama canın sıkıldığı için oynayamıyosun. Oyunu yarım bırakıp çıkınca da kendini suçlu hissediyosun. İnanılmaz.

Portal 2 ist zwar nicht unbedingt das allerneueste Spiel, aber nach meiner Meinung: eins der besten Spiele die man auf Steam kaufen kann. Dieses Puzzleprinzip ist sehr cool gemacht und umgesetzt. An manchen Stellen kann man schon echt ziemlich lange knobeln aber alles ist schaffbar. Portal 2 ist von der Spiellänge her viel länger als Portal 1, dass heißt man muss sich Zeit nehmen um es durchzuspielen, weil ein Tag kaum dazu reicht. Weierhin ist es sehr, sehr komplex aufgebaut, mit einer schönen Story, vielen coolen Testkammern mit interessanten Aufgaben und einem interessanten Plott-Twist am Ende. Alles in allem ein richtig gutes Spiel. Die 20€ waren es auf JEDEN Fall wert.
Bardzo dobry sequel pierwszej części. Ogromnych zmian nie ma i jest to bardziej ewolucja niż rewolucja, ale to wciąż bardzo dobra gra.

[i]Portal 2[/i] is a superb game and sequel, but in my opinion doesn't quite live up to the success of the original. [i]Portal 2[/i], compared to [i]Portal[/i], has more focus on the narrative - this isn't a bad thing, but the game loses some of the simplicity and feeling of the original as a result.

The first game handled the isolation of Aperture Science in a perfect way. Glados would only talk to you at the start of a test and at the end, but would be constantly monitoring you the entire time; this created an atmosphere that I don't think any other game has quite managed, it felt both isolated, and... not, at the same time. It wasn't a feeling of company you wanted though, as it felt totalitarian, especially towards the latter half of the game where the tests became increasingly more dangerous.

The second game throws this minimal-dialogue approach out the window in favour of a more traditional story, and it suffers heavily as a result. It no longer feels like you've been left alone to solve puzzles in the name of 'science', as Wheatley and Glados both act as comedy relief characters at the start of, during, at the end of, and in-between tests. There's never a moment where you're left alone to reflect on the isolation of the situation, and the atmosphere feels significantly lighter as a result - despite the game being much darker visually.

This clash between the visual style of the dilapidated Aperture and the light-hearted story destroys the atmosphere. It no longer feels like [i]Portal[/i] did, it feels like a completely different game with the same game mechanics.

All of my complaints here don't ruin [i]Portal 2[/i] though, obviously. The game is highly polished and the puzzles are significantly more complex than in the original, with more puzzle elements (such as the gels) adding to the gameplay in a meaningful way. I just can't get over the way they butchered the atmosphere of [i]Portal[/i] however, considering that the atmosphere was one of the things that made [i]Portal[/i] so good.

I think that's enough of a rant about the story/atmosphere of [i]Portal 2[/i] now. The game is absolutely superb and is well deserving of the high praise it receives, but I find it to be somewhat of a sideways step in the world that [i]Portal[/i] had already established.
